pros: College of Saint Mary is one of the best places I've ever worked. There's nothing like working on a college campus, especially this one. There is a collaborative effort between the different departments, and employees are mission-driven. Everyone is friendly and willing to work for the betterment of the college. I truly enjoy coming to work every day, and I feel like have a great work-life balance. Plus, the food in the dining hall is awesome.
cons: I have nothing bad to say about CSM.

pros: Working with students, hard working staff in most departments, college focus on affordability
cons: The move to a Provost leading day to day operations was brutal with staff being fired for no apparent reason.

pros: Great atmosphere working with a variety of oeople
cons: Small college not a lot of wiggle room

pros: The students. The program helping single young mothers. The DACA recipients.
cons: The administration here is absolutely toxic. The turnover rate is about 50% each year because of it. I've never worked in such a horrible environment. It's absolutely gutting because the work they do is important, but they destroy their employees with micromanaging, microaggressions (and out-right aggressions), unsupportive leaders, etc.

pros: the students and seeing them succeed
cons: leadership leaves you in the dark all the time, toxic place to work, major micromanaging

review_title: Low moral among employees and no improvement in sight
pros: College of Saint Mary has a wonderful mission statement and several programs that do great things for the community.  There are also some wonderful staff and faculty members who still work there.
cons:
There are too many to list:
-Low moral among employees
-High health insurance costs
-Management is oppressive
-High turnover rate because of management
-Too few employees to cover departments which means high stress
-Hardly any integrity among senior level leaders
-They do not value innovation
-There is an environment of fear

Because of these cons, College of Saint Mary has become an organization with an infamous reputation.  With high turnover and employee dissatisfaction, departments cannot accomplish their goals of supporting College of Saint Mary's wonderful programs.  This organization would accomplish so much more if the leadership would change.  Until then, I'm afraid that employees will continue to come, encounter an awful work environment, and then leave a mess behind them.

review_title: The place has a village atmosphere
pros: Since it is a small school, you get to know everyone pretty well, so it feels like a small town. Students are encouraged to speak up in running the affairs of the college.  All employees have free access to the gym.  They recently put a cap on tuition for their students.
cons: There is a high proportion of part-time to full-time faculty.  Because of this, there is a lot of faculty turnover at the college.  A small, but very vocal, minority of students have a very entitled attitude, and if they don't get their way, they will make your life difficult as an instructor.  This has led to a couple of my colleagues dropping in the middle of the semester.

review_title: One of the best jobs I've ever had
pros:
This is one of the best jobs I've ever had. Been here almost 3 years now, and I'm really coming into my own in my role within the university. I have plenty of responsibility for my role and it makes me feel needed and valued at the college. My opinion is also heard on issues I feel strongly about. I really enjoy working here, and everyone is so welcoming and nice.
A few things that stand out:
- Flexible work hours
- Not micromanaged
- Freedom to tackle new and fun projects for the betterment of the university
- Opinion is valued
- Compensation $$ higher here than in past jobs
- Mission and culture really make it feel like you're impacting students
cons:
- Strict "no jeans" policy
- Sometimes there's a lack of communication from the top down on priorities

pros: The students overall are very good to work with although the troublemakers seem to get their way more often than not. The dining hall has good food most of the time for lunch. Generally most of the people who work here are pretty down to earth.
cons: The employee turnover is terrible across all departments. People just disappear. There is a lot of fear across the campus at all times. You never know when you're going to get in trouble or for what. Good employees get fed up and leave or get fired for mysterious and often "personal" reasons. Bad employees stay because nothing ever happens to them for fear of a lawsuit.

review_title: I Wish I Could Say Good Things
pros: Everyone was very nice during interview. Seemed like people cared about students. Most people are approachable.
cons:
CONSTANT Backstabbing among faculty, staff and administrators.  ZERO trust between departments or in the senior leadership since one minute we're doing one thing and the next minute we're doing the complete opposite because the VP was bullied into place. 

Health benefits that leave you with little left after taxes. Compensation is within market but health benefits and retirement are well below "good."

Those employees who stay suffer. Either the position goes unfilled for six months or we get more added on to us since we know everything. Most departments run shorthanded and people have to come in early, through lunch, stay late or come in during the weekends.

pros: Small college full of helpful and passionate individuals. Nice cafeteria, centrally located.
cons:
Not all instructors follow the mission statement. It is sad to see great students leave, especially the ones from the pre-PA/ PA program.

I have witnessed discrimination and racism against minority students/ instructors and even though employees have been reported, nothing has happened.

pros: College of Saint Mary is a wonderful place to work. The faculty and staff care about each other and are truly devoted to the students and fulfilling the mission of the college. It's a family atmosphere on campus.
cons: None.  Every place has its challenges. CSM Leadership strives to listen and make changes whenever issues arise.  Many companies and non-profits just ignore problems.  CSM is always looking for ways to make positive strides forward.

pros:
Close to Arby's, QT and Walmart
Free Parking but it's not like there isn't any
Plenty of Oxygen to breathe
cons: Most negative place I have ever worked, by far. This comes from the top down, where the President rules with an iron fist. She is unpredictable, manipulative and dishonest. And it's so small, you can't escape her.  No one wants to work there and it has at least a 50% employee turnover rate per year. People put in 50 - 60 hours a week and it's never enough.

review_title: Extremely demeaning. You want it to be a good place but it isn't.
pros: The mission really keeps everyone invested and the potential for this school is through the roof. There are some exceptional employees, if given the opportunity they could make CSM a fantastic place.
cons: It is difficult to even begin to describe the environment at CSM. I think the best word to explain the company is petty. They higher their alums and if you are not an alumnae then you are treated as if you are incompetent. The president continuously discusses how amazing they treat the students, how she is invested, but does not support her own staff. The students experience the high turnover and talk about their frustrations with so many adjunct teachers. Also, the students become entitled due to the president bending over backwards to try to keep them on campus. The micromanagement cannot be expressed more; they read emails, ask why you left for a restroom break, and chastise those who have children. There is zero training when you join the organization and yet rip you apart if you make a mistake (that was never taught to you). It's sad that these reviews have been consistent since 2011 and yet nothing has been done. If you approach HR, they shrug and say sorry we can't do anything. It's a fear culture and you can never do enough even when you are putting in all your efforts. I wanted CSM to be more and stayed far too long because of this. They need to make changes or this school will fail like all other all women's colleges.

pros: The unbelievable support from CSM has been amazing through the Covid-19 pandemic. Leadership has given flexibility, support and free food to help with the stress and uncertainty.
cons: Not everyone had the flexibility to work at home because they were needed on campus, but that meant they kept their position.

review_title: A great place to work; amazing colleagues
pros: I truly enjoy coming to work each and every day.  I love the people I work with and the community CSM has built. The university stands behind its mission and is making college more affordable for its students.
cons: It's a nonprofit so there is always a lot to do.

pros: Slightly better health insurance than other non-profits.
cons: As an employee for over 5 years, I witnessed shocking behavior from the high level management staff. Sexism, racism, and prejudice runs rampant here. Put plainly, if you're not a white Catholic woman either working here or as a student, there's a likelihood that you will run into problems here.

pros: A place with a nice atmosphere that makes coming into work everyday enjoyable.
cons: Some people aren't there to be helpful and can have there clicks, but there are other great people who make up for it.

pros: Good academic programs that help women get an education and improve their lives with better careers
cons: Too much turnover among staff and low morale among employees.  The people left behind have too much work to do.
